text: Interesting, never tried such thing. Is it safe to get reference of view in broadcast receiver(what if app is not open)? And *you can only change View from UI thread* which creates it, otherwise you will get exception if you try to change view from other Threads <@U2QHEEGBX>

attachments.title: Retrofit 2 with only form-data
attachments.text: I am trying to make POST request using the Retrofit 2. The request type is form-data NOT application/x-www-form-urlencoded.I am only posting data not the files in the request and the response is ...

text: the server I am querying wil give me a new jwt token
everytime an update was made
`Constants.ACTION_ID` is just a String
I went to postman and use that new jwt token and to my surprise the returned body to me was not the updated version
I went to manually made this request to postman doing similar steps and when I query using the new token it returned me the updated data
it appears that within my app, it didn't mapped the variables I am sending
the problem is the server still returned a status 200 OK and a body containing the new token
I’d suggest learning how to use retrofit before continuing
<https://futurestud.io/tutorials/retrofit-getting-started-and-android-client>

attachments.title: Retrofit — Getting Started and Create an Android Client
attachments.text: Future Studio provides on-demand learning & wants you to become a better Android (Retrofit, Gson, Glide) and Node.js/hapi.js developer!
attachments.fallback: Retrofit — Getting Started and Create an Android Client

text: Anyone here know why LocationServices’ getLastLocation returns null even though the GPS is on and the user has granted location permissions?

Some of the proposed solutions I found are requesting for location updates and listen to them. But it doesn’t make much sense, as I don’t need to track the location in real time, I just need the user’s current location.
<@U3CL8K1L5|jdanielnd> has joined the channel

<@U3BTWNZFT|cubanazcuy> has joined the channel
<@U3CNGU56H|ethan> has joined the channel
<@U3BV1B8BS|ogarochek> has joined the channel
<@U21R4GP5J> Is it doing it everytime? In my experience, it does happen but rarely. It also returns null if your GoogleApiClient isn’t connected, but i’ll assume you took care of that.
So when it happens, you can listen for location updates, get 1 update and then unregister.
But if it is always null, then something else is wrong. Try a different device maybe.
